tool.name: Minfi Map to Genome
tool.description: mapping Ilumina methylation array data to the genome

configfiles.configfile:
require("minfi", quietly = TRUE) require("IlluminaHumanMethylation450kanno.ilmn12.hg19", quietly = TRUE)
RSet <- get(load('$rset'))
GRSet <- mapToGenome(RSet)
save(GRSet,file = '$grset')

param.name: rset
param.label: Methylation Data to Map
param.help: This class holds preprocessed data for Illumina methylation microarrays.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Minfi Map to Genome maps Ilumina methylation array data to the genome using 450k annotation package. Depending on the genome, not all methylation loci may have a genomic position.
**Input information**
Input data is a RatioSet class R object holding preprocessed data for Illumina methylation microarrays. It contains respectively the Beta value matrix, M value matrix and the Copy Number matrix.
**Output information**
The output is an a GenomicRatioSet R object class holding preprocessed data for Illumina methylation microarrays, mapped to a genomic location.
